intro: Psoralea megalantha, commonly known as the large-leaved psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. Psoralea megalantha is also noted for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
